definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: [[לָכַד]]:121 vb. capture, seize, take (by lot) (Ph. [[לכד]] take out, choose(?); Targum [[לְכַד]] as BH; Ar. lakada is strike, push, with the hand, etc., = mil kadun  pestle, cf. mod. lakada attack Wetzst:ZMG xxii. 1868, 140; lakida stick or cleave to);—

capture, seize (not in P) c. acc., usu. a city or town, in war Ju Jdg 1:8, Jdg 1:12, Jos 8:21, Jos 10:1 (JE), De 2:35 + 48 t. (but Ju Jdg 1:18 del. as gloss Bu Kit GFM al.); land Jos 10:42 (D), Da 11:18; water-courses (fords), Ju Jdg 3:28, Jdg 7:24, Jdg 7:24, Jdg 12:8; obj. men (usu. princes, kings) in battle Ju Jdg 7:25, Jdg 8:12, Jdg 8:14, Jos 11:12, Jos 11:17 (D), 2Ch 22:9, 2Ch 33:11; captives and spoils 2Sa 8:4 = 1Ch 18:4; of Saul's seizing the kingdom ([[הַמְּלוּכָה]]), i.e. acquiring it actually by force of arms 1Sa 14:47; also of Samson's catching the foxes Ju Jdg 15:4; of a lion catching his prey Am 3:4; of a trap, snare, [[לָכוֹד יִלְכּוֹד]] Am 3:5. †
fig. of entrapping men Je 5:26, Ps 35:8, cf. Pr 5:22, Job 5:13 and (of a pit) Je 18:22. †
of taking by lot Jos 7:14, Jos 7:14, Jos 7:14, Jos 7:17 (JE ; v.
be captured in war, of city 1Ki 16:18, 2Ki 18:10, Je 38:28, Je 38:28, Je 48:1, Je 48:41, Je 50:2, Je 50:9, Je 50:24, Je 51:31, Je 51:41, Zec 14:2; of men Je 51:56, La 4:20 (cf.

of men, be caught, viz. in a snare or trap, only fig., usu. by divine judgment Is 8:15, Is 24:18, Is 28:13, Ps 9:16, Ps 59:13, Pr 6:2, Pr 11:6, Je 6:11, Je 8:9; so of Moab Je 48:7, Je 48:44; of being ensnared by a woman Ec 7:26; of being caught by cords of distress, [[בְּחַבְלֵי עָׂנִי]], Job 36:8.
be taken by lot Jos 7:15, Jos 7:16, Jos 7:17, Jos 7:18 (all JE), 1 S 1Sa 10:20, 1Sa 10:21, 1Sa 10:21, 1Sa 14:41, 1Sa 14:42 (cf.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 mpl.; [[יִתְלַכְּדוּ וְלאׁ יִתְפָּרָָדוּ]] Job 41:9 they grasp each other, and cannot be separated, of crocodile's scales (‖ [[אִישׁ בְּאָחִיהוּ]] [[יְדֻבָָּקוּ]]); [[פְּנֵי תְהוֹם יִתְלַכָָּדוּ]] Job 38:30 the face of the deep compacts (of freezing; ‖[[כָּאֶבֶן מַיִם יִתְחַבָָּאוּ]]; vbs. transp., plausibly, by Me Bi Siegf Bu).
